author: potuz
content: This is the "attack" I mention above but if we simply disregard the signature for finalized blocks and even zero it out when serving finalized blocks I see no actual attack here

author: potuz
content: Even infura and what not, the only place one would think signatures are useful to keep is if two contenting branches are finalized but even in that case it's fine to "forget" the signatures

author: potuz
content: You can always provide a recent unfinalized block with a valid signature that points to the finalized checkpoint

author: ajsutton
content: Yeah, I think if the API doesn't expose unvalidated signatures and P2P is updated to avoid nodes being penalised if they don't store old signatures then it's not an issue. It isn't the same as just saying you trust the checkpoint state though because you can manually verify the checkpoint state easily,  but have to individually verify every signature if you care about them.
